intro: Urophyllum paucinerve, commonly known as the slender leaf urophyllum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and has narrow, elongated leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Urophyllum paucinerve is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid conditions.
